course_title: Spec. Topics in German Studies: Literary Translation Workshop
class_notes:
(Same as MESAS 370 4, JS 380 2, CPLT 369 2) 
Literary Translation Workshop


By engaging with foundational theoretical approaches and learning from working translators, students will develop skills in the art of literary translation in the supportive setting of a workshop-style course. The final project will include contributing a translation to our class anthology of short stories for children and youth. Knowledge of a language other than English at the 300 level or above required; prior translation experience not required.
course_description: Taught in English. An interdisciplinary course intended to provide in-depth study of formative elements, influences, and movements in German-speaking culture(s). May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
sections: Class Nbr: 1520, Section #: 2, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: M 2:30-5:15p, Instructor: Uca/Udel, Status: Open
